author: William A. Galston
title: The Perpetual Battle for Freedom
text:
This past weekend, Jews gathered, as they have done for millennia, to recall and celebrate the exodus from Egypt. At one point in the Haggada, the Passover holiday’s core text, comes an admonition that had never arrested my attention before this year. The passage explains that it doesn’t matter how wise you are or how learned in the tradition, nor how old you are or how many times you’ve read the Passover story. It is still your duty to do it again each year. 

I had never asked myself why this was so. But this time I did,...
